data.title: Metal Print of Wedding of Princess Irina Pavlovna Paley
data.meta_description: Metal Print of Princess Olga Valerianovna Paley (1865 1929), the second wife of Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich of Russia
data.text:
Metal Print 20"x16" (51x41cm)

Bring timeless elegance and regal charm to your home or office with our Media Storehouse Metal Prints. Featuring this exquisite image of Princess Olga Valerianovna Paley and her family at the wedding of her daughter Princess Irina Pavlovna Paley, this rights-managed photograph from Mary Evans Prints Online is now available in a stunning metal print format. The vibrant colors and exceptional detail of this image are beautifully preserved on high-quality metal, creating a unique and eye-catching piece of art that is sure to impress. Order your Media Storehouse Metal Print today and add a touch of history and sophistication to your space.

Your image is printed photographically and bonded to a 3.5mm thick, Dibond board (black polyethylene sandwiched between two sheets of white coated aluminium). The panel is then sealed with a gloss protective covering. Supplied complete with a wall mount which holds the print 10mm from the wall.

Made with durable metal and luxurious printing techniques, metal prints bring images to life and add a modern touch to any space

Estimated Product Size is 40.6cm x 50.8cm (16" x 20")

These are individually made so all sizes are approximate

Artwork printed orientated as per the preview above, with landscape (horizontal) or portrait (vertical) orientation to match the source image.

FEATURES IN THESE COLLECTIONS

SECURE PAYMENTS

We happily accept a wide range of payment options so you can pay for the things you need in the way that is most convenient for you

MADE IN THE UK

Safe Shipping with 30 Day Money Back Guarantee

FREE PERSONALISATION

We are proud to offer a range of customisation including Cropping, Captions, and Filters. Zoom Cropping can be adjusted in the Basket.

FREE COLORIZATION SERVICE

You can choose advanced AI Colorization for this picture at no extra charge!

EDITORS COMMENTS

In this evocative photograph, Princess Olga Valerianovna Paley (1865-1929), the second wife of Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich of Russia (1860-1918), gracefully stands among the wedding party at the marriage of her daughter, Princess Irina Pavlovna Paley (1903-1990), to her cousin Prince Feodor Alexandrovich (later Count Hubert Conquere de Monbrison) on May 21, 1923, in Paris. The grand occasion is marked by the elegant attire and the radiant smiles of the assembled guests. Princess Olga, dressed in a sophisticated gown and veil, exudes an air of regal beauty and maternal pride. Her presence adds a touch of history and tradition to the joyous celebration, as she was the daughter of Grand Duke Vladimir Alexandrovich of Russia and Princess Irene of Hesse and by Rhine. Her marriage to Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich in 1889 was a significant political alliance, as it strengthened the ties between the Russian and German royal families. The marriage of Princess Irina to Prince Feodor, who was the son of Grand Duke Paul's brother, was a happy union that took place in the aftermath of the Russian Revolution. The couple's wedding marked a new chapter in their lives, as they began their journey together in exile from their native Russia. The photograph captures a moment of joy and unity amidst the challenges and uncertainties of the time. The intricate details of the bridesmaids' dresses, the delicate lace veils, and the elegant decor of the venue all contribute to the timeless beauty of this historical image. The photograph is a poignant reminder of the rich history and traditions of the Russian royal family, and the enduring bonds of love and family that transcend political and social upheaval.
